<font size="6"> About </font>

<font size="3">I am a PhD Candidate in Computational Bioscience at [The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus](https://www.cuanschutz.edu/). I am funded as an NIH/NLM T15 Biomedical Informatics and Data Science trainee under the guidance of [Dr. Catherine Lozupone](https://www.lozuponelab.com/). My research involves development of computational methods for feature selection in longitudinal microbiome studies using machine learning methods. My projects include research on autism spectrum disorder and HIV. I received my BS in Microbiology from the University of California, San Diego and my MS in Bioinformatics and Medical Informatics from San Diego State University. I began my career in the wet lab and transitioned to computational work including investigations of the mycobiome of the built environment; pharmacogenetics; laboratory information management systems (LIMS); website development and natural language processing (NLP). I plan to graduate in 2024 and seek a career in industry as a bioinformatics scientist.
